channel.title: The good old right click disconnect. Will rep++ if descent help
channel.description:
Hello.
I'm not a complete noob to coding, so I'm annoyed at this point that I cannot solve this problem.
Basically, when an NPC is right clicked then traded you disconnect. Left click works fine. I HAVE added the
WanneShop = #;
into the area marked /* Start of SECOND CLICK SHOPS /*
Doesen't seem to make a difference though. Rep++ to anybody that helps well :)

item.title: The good old right click disconnect. Will rep++ if descent help
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Have you recently changed a few things or was it a fresh download and run? Have they worked before this and now suddenly started crashing? Because you’ve probably changed something either accidently or intentionally.

Maybe try (if you’ve kept the WinRAR version) un-archive a fresh copy and see if the problem still occurs, if it does not then simple replace all your shop methods.

Read full topic

item.title: The good old right click disconnect. Will rep++ if descent help
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Oh, I meant try clicking the second option on Weaponsmaster to see if it’s the actual packet or the opening the shop interface. Just click his second option and if nothing happens (doesn’t crash) you know it’s the shops and not the actual second click option.

Read full topic

item.title: The good old right click disconnect. Will rep++ if descent help
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

There doesen’t seem to be anything like that near the second click case, but there is one under my first click case. It looks like this:

[code] case 155: // first Click npc
int NPCSlot = (misc.HexToInt(inStream.buffer, 0, packetSize) / 1000);
int NPCID = server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSlot].npcType;

        faceNPC(NPCSlot);
        boolean FishingGo = false;
        boolean PutNPCCoords = false;

[/code]

Wait on second thoughts that looks the same as the first one.

I will make a quick shop using the weaponsmaster and see if that does anything. Thanks for your help so far.

Read full topic
item.source: The good old right click disconnect. Will rep++ if descent help

item.title: The good old right click disconnect. Will rep++ if descent help
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

What’s the declaration at the top?

Like:

public class ClickNPC implements PacketType {
	public static final int ATTACK_NPC = 72, MAGE_NPC = 131, FIRST_CLICK = 155, SECOND_CLICK = 17, THIRD_CLICK = 21;

SECOND_CLICK = 17.

That tells the client/server what packet to send when the second option is clicked - maybe yours is set as something different.

Your code don’t look PI-ish to me, and if they are different revisions then they could be different packets.

Try an NPC that doesn’t have “Trade” as a second click option, and see if it is the shops or the actual second click option. A good NPC to try this on is Weaponsmaster as he has Attack and Talk.

Read full topic
item.source: The good old right click disconnect. Will rep++ if descent help

item.title: The good old right click disconnect. Will rep++ if descent help
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

I’ll post what I have. Yes, I believe so.

Start of the case:

case 17: // second Click npc NPCSlot = ((misc.HexToInt(inStream.buffer, 0, packetSize) / 1000) - 128); NPCID = server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCSlot].npcType; faceNPC(NPCSlot); FishingGo = false; PutNPCCoords = false;

What my shop NPC code looks like…


  } else if (NPCID == 2262) { // Shop Of Abyss
                WanneShop = 4;
